CatDescriptText: Mr. Walter Mitchell, 1533 Brighton Place, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 21, 1957, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that the proposed six-day-a-week school attendance, as proposed by Governor Leader, is the answer to the Russian challenge in scientific education?" answer reads: "No, I don't. I feel as though the kids should have one day a week for homework and study.  In fact, the day should belong to the kids to do what they want to do."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Walter Mitchell, wearing hat, moustache, dark double breaster suit jacket, and light colored tweed coat, standing in front of light colored marble pillar between store windows with jewely and decorative ceramics displays
